column4: If I put a packages line in my sources.list file as "main restricted universe multiverse" will it pull in all pacakges?
so I don't need to have multiple lines?
heh ok, let me try to put all that together.
it means that there were dependancy problems and you should use apt-get dist-upgrade.
upgrade has a built-in safety check.
something changed that is more major, so you can either use dist-upgrade, or just upgrade and go into Synaptic and check on the held-back packages.
Whatsisname is not correct about it upgrading to Dapper.
once Dapper comes out, you can use dist-upgrade to update your Breezy system.  But you must first manually change your repositories, or it'll stay as Breezy.
so it is quite safe (as far as not surprising you with a development release!).
This machine's getting configured and then sent out into the wild, patching opportunities will be pretty slim afterwards.
my main point is that dist-upgrade won't suddenly throw you ahead into dapper.
Right, that's an important detail, and more in line with what I'd expect :)
it's all based on whats in the sources.list file anyways, isn't it?
for that, there's always browsing in Synaptic after the fact.  :)
